informationId.explanation: The assessed variant produces the same amino acid change (p.Met2083Ile) as known pathogenic variant c.6249G>A.  But that change is pathogenic because it has been shown to disrupt splicing and create a premature stop codon. Prediction tools do not suggest c.6249G>C disrupts splicing.

criterion.description: Same amino acid change as a previously established pathogenic variant regardless of nucleotide change
criterion.shortDescription: Nucleotide change results in previously reported pathogenic amino acid change

author: Steven Harrison
description:
Assessed variant: DNAH5 - NM_001369.2:c.6249G>C - p.Met2083Ile
A different variant creating the same AA change is pathogenic (c.6249G>A - p.Met2083Ile) but that change is pathogenic because it has been shown to disrupt splicing and create a premature stop codon. Prediction tools do not suggest c.6429G>C disrupts splicing so applying PS1 (as met by c.6429G>A) is likely not appropriate.
